comment: The Law of Quadratic Reciprocity, see also theorem 9.8 in [ApostolNT] p. 185. If ` P ` and ` Q ` are distinct odd primes, then the product of the Legendre symbols ` ( P /L Q ) ` and ` ( Q /L P ) ` is the parity of ` ( ( P - 1 ) / 2 ) x. ( ( Q - 1 ) / 2 ) ` . This uses Eisenstein's proof, which also has a nice geometric interpretation - see ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proofs_of_quadratic_reciprocity . This is Metamath 100 proof #7. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jun-2015.)
